values:
Nesting again here. My cat is about to drop a belly full of kittens so have just dragged all the boxes out of the laundry i have been to lazy to unpack and sorted them to go out to the shed. I have set her up a litter tray and bed in the cupboard so she can hide when the time comes.

My last cat to have kittens started birthing under the boys beds, even though i had a beautiful quiet set up for her to labour in so am hoping to avoid that one again

I so badly want to go and finish the fencing DH started for the horses, i have my 'Rodger Boy' out of his yard, mowing my backyard at the moment as his feed his running low in his yard. We have acres of long grass he can eat but no finished fence to keep him in If i stepfoot near it DH will have my guts for garters so will just have to keep nagging him

Got called down to the school at lunch time yesterday to pick DS up, he had fallen over and knocked his front tooth out, so now he has no front teeth and is quiet the looker Tooth fairy must have beaten him to finding his tooth on the ground because no searching turned it up at school and his 'Tooth cup" had money in it this morning, sooooo... ROFL! Clever tooth fairy that one

Ok i have dribbled enough now, washing machine is beeping to be emptied so i better get a move on

All is well. 

Adam's new job = great
Kid = excellent
House = clean 
Baby = full of beans
Me = hiding from greenpeace (lol)
Horsey = lovable, i love him, he is precious (it's driving me mental not being allowed to ride him)
Samuel = Lost his top front tooth last night, tooth fairy compensated him accordingly :)

All in all in all, life is absolutely positively brilliant :D Happy, happy, happy :)

..and i finally do an update LOL

PG is going well. Pushing 23 weeks now (well 22w6d) and feeling ok. Baby is intent on laying transverse majority of the time which can prove uncomfortable but he is kicking and thrashing about in there so that's all that matters :) Am needing to get a little more motivation and start getting baby items organised though ;)
 

Sam has settled into new school well. Back to school Monday for last term. I can't believe we are in the final stages of his first year at school, it just goes so fast :(

Layney is all excited about starting her Prep orientation. She had her final round of needles before school (what a drama) and is pesterng me as to when she can go to school LOL

Not sure how hayden will go being only one at home, but baby should be here by the time school starts next yr (hopefully) so he won't be alone for long lol

Weather is starting to warm up here, which in turn is bringing out the snakes. MIL dog was bitten the other night while we were visiting. $1200 later dog is ok but offending snake is yet to be caught :( Am keeping lawns low and paddock slashed so even though they will be around, i will be able to see them coming, well i hope so. 

We have a new addition arriving Monday, a horse for Adam :) very excited, and although he is rather big (17h) i can't wait to have him around :)

Speaking of Adam, he started a new job today. Endless miles on the highway and have worn him down so he switching over to local for a while. He will be home on weekends and every night, this will take some getting used to LOL!!!

All in all, life is good :)

Back on LJ :)

After a fair while away i have decided to come back and start a journal again :) Much has been happening here and i would like to get it all down in one spot rather fill everyone in as i go :)

Hi to anyone who remembers me, and i hope you are all doing well!

I will be back later to make a decent post after kids are fed, settled and i have had a fiddle with the rather dodgy looking settings here :p

xxx Kate
